comments.body: Is this deliberately using single backticks rather than double?  I guess that is what we do elsewhere in this section, though the rest of the docs would use double backticks (and get code formatting). But probably too much effort to update this entire section.
It's consistent with how it is done in this section, so I'll leave it for now. If you think that it's important to change everything to double backticks, then let's do that as part of another ticket.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +191,195 @@
To illustrate :doc:`contract keys </daml/reference/contract-keys>`, suppose that the contract key for a `PaintOffer` consists of the reference number and the painter.
So Alice can refer to the `PaintOffer` by its key `(P, P123)`.
To make this explicit, we use the notation `PaintOffer @P A &P123` for contracts, where `@` and `&` mark the parts that belong to a key.
(The difference between `@` and `&` will be explained in the :ref:`integrity section <da-signatories-agreements-maintainers>`.)

comments.body: What's this change? The footnote seemed to work fine before, or am I missing something
There was a space between the `.` and the footnote mark. With the `\`, the footnote mark sits directly after the full stop.

as a sequence growing from left to right as time progresses. Below,

comments.body: I would remove the maintainer annotations from these examples.
So you'd write this as `PaintOffer A &P Bank &P123`? But then we have to change the `&` notation in the privacy section later.
We keep the & and @ as discussed.
